title: 111_hr3282
content: The program provides readjustment and mental health care services to veterans of Operation Iraqi Freedom and Operation Enduring Freedom. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will establish a program to provide peer outreach, support, counseling, and mental health services to veterans of Operation Iraqi Freedom and Operation Enduring Freedom, as well as education and support to their immediate family members. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will establish a program to provide education, support, counseling, and mental health services to veterans and their immediate family members for readjustment to civilian life and recovery from deployment-related injuries or illnesses. Community mental health centers and qualified entities will be contracted to provide these services. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will contract with community mental health centers and qualified entities to provide services for veterans in areas not adequately served by VA facilities. Contracts will require employing veterans, using telehealth services, participating in training programs, and complying with Department protocols. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will contract with community mental health centers and qualified entities to provide services for veterans. Contractors must employ veterans, use telehealth services, participate in training programs, and comply with Department protocols. They must also submit annual reports to the Secretary with information on veterans served, diagnoses, and treatments provided. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will contract with community mental health centers and qualified entities to provide services for veterans, including submitting clinical summary information for each veteran served. Additionally, a national not-for-profit mental health organization will be contracted to implement a national program for training veterans in peer-outreach and peer-support services. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will contract with a national not-for-profit mental health organization to train veterans for peer-outreach and peer-support services. Additionally, clinicians at community mental health centers will undergo training to provide services tailored to veterans who served in Operation Iraqi Freedom or Operation Enduring Freedom. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will provide services for veterans who served in Operation Iraqi Freedom or Operation Enduring Freedom, using best practices and technologies. Reports on the implementation plan are required within specific timeframes. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will submit reports to Congress on the implementation of a program for veterans who served in Operation Iraqi Freedom or Operation Enduring Freedom. The report will include information on the number of veterans receiving services and an evaluation of the services provided. The report to Congress will evaluate the provision of services for veterans from Operation Iraqi Freedom or Operation Enduring Freedom, including recommendations for extending service periods and assessing training programs.
